notes.title: Flutter Architecture Best Practices
notes.content:
# Flutter Architecture

## Clean Architecture Layers
- **Presentation**: Widgets + Riverpod
- **Domain**: Business logic
- **Data**: Repositories + APIs

## Key Principles
1. Dependency inversion
2. Single responsibility
3. Feature-first folders
4. Immutable state

notes.title: Dart & Flutter Design Patterns
notes.content:
# Design Patterns in Dart

## Creational
- Singleton (SharedPreferences wrapper)
- Factory (ModelConfig.fromJson)
- Builder (Drift query builder)

## Behavioral
- Observer (Riverpod StateNotifier)
- Command (Tool calling)
- Strategy (Provider switching)

messages.content: Can you help me plan my week? I have a lot going on.

Of course! Let me help organize your week.

**High Priority:**
- Review quarterly budget (Feb 12)
- Sprint demo slides (Feb 10)
- Accessibility fixes (Feb 11)

**Suggested Schedule:**
- Mon: Demo prep + budget start
- Tue: Accessibility fixes
- Wed: Dentist + backups
- Thu: Portfolio updates
- Fri: Reading + planning

Want me to adjust anything?
What's the difference between Riverpod and Provider?

## Provider (Legacy)
- Built on InheritedWidget
- Runtime errors possible
- Simpler but less flexible

## Riverpod (Recommended) 
- Compile-time safety
- Independent of widget tree
- Auto-dispose
- Better testing

Prism uses Riverpod for all state management.

files.name: backup.sh
files.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Backup script
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d)
tar -czf backup_$DATE.tar.gz ~/Documents
echo "Backup complete: backup_$DATE.tar.gz"

files.name: deploy.py
files.content:
# deploy.py
import subprocess
import sys

def deploy(env='staging'):
    print(f'Deploying to {env}...')
    subprocess.run(['flutter', 'build', 'apk', '--release'])
    print('Deploy complete!')

if __name__ == '__main__':
    deploy(sys.argv[1] if len(sys.argv) > 1 else 'staging')

files.name: prism_notes.md
files.content:
# Prism Development Notes

## Architecture Decisions
- Riverpod over Provider for compile-time safety
- Drift over Hive for relational data
- llama_sdk for local inference (FFI)

## Performance Notes
- Gemma 3 1B: ~15 tok/s on Pixel 7
- TinyLlama: ~25 tok/s on Pixel 7
